page.title: 02BADBURY RINGS
page.content: {BADBURY RINGS-GENERAL INFORMATION {BADBURY RINGS IS AN}ancient monument it's an Iron age hill fort.{BADBURY RINGS}is found between {WIMBORNE}and{BLANFORD FORUM,}in Dorset on the road B3082.It has a chalk downland scenery. {BADBURY RINGS}is looked after by the{NATIONAL TRUST}.If you would like information about BADBURY RINGS contact KINGSTON LACY ESTATE office, Harbutts, Wimborne, Dorset BH21 4DS. It has two car parks open from 8am-6pm,{NO CHARGE. {HISTORY OF BADBURY RINGS} The rings are the remains of an iron age hill fort built about 2-3000B.C. Roman roads can be seen on the rings.
